page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF GILBERDYKE
page.content:
{ }
The village of Gilberdyke in the late 1970's was by-passed by the M62 motorway. This reduced the heavy flow of continuous commercial traffic moving to and from Hull.
Originally a farming and agricultural community this village has changed greatly over the years. Recent housing development has trebled the population over six years, turning Gilberdyke into a dormitory town for Hull.
Gilberdyke is served by a busy shopping precinct, light industry and other commercial concerns have developed to provide employment within the village, replacing much of the traditional agricultural employment.
